Reviews.Title: “Berlin Half Marathon - perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: katesamar
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay while running in the half marathon Sunday 1 April 2012 and was picked due to location for start and finish, the hotel was perfect for that. We appreciated the early check in after travelling from the UK. Room was immaculate, clean and modern with one of the best bathrooms I've seen and very very quiet. We didn't eat in the hotel although it had a nice bar at the back of the resturant which we used. Good location with easy transport links to and from airport, plus regular tourist buses. Excellent italian restaurant just down the road which we used twice and a german restaurant across the road. Great easter market taking place in the town centre which proved good browsing. Only negative was no tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “very excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Joel810
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased by this hotel. We paid 68 Euros per night within a weekend package that included breakfast. Breakfast turned out to be a huge buffet offering a vast variety of cold as well as warm dishes. The interaction with the staff was without any exception nice and friendly. The room was reasonably spacious and really nicely outfitted. Most of the furniture looked brand new. An eye-catcher definitively was the bathroom which came with a marble washstand. The location right next to Alexanderplatz is just perfect for visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our city break”
Reviews.Author: marsbareastbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights 16th and 17th April 2012. Very nice clean hotel, well situated offering excellent accommodation and facilities. Would have been nice if it had an indoor pool. Staff very friendly and helpful. Restaurant has very good food at reasonable prices - definitely worth dining in hotel. Rooms have english TV news programmes. Overall no complaints and highly recommended. If you are looking for a good lunchtime restaurant to have a snack then try the one on the 5th floor of the Galeria shopping centre - their cakes are to die for and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped again into something good.”
Reviews.Author: gonzfamilyexplorers
Reviews.Content: We were booked at H2 next door and bumped into Ramada and I have to say since there was not much change in location, and considering the traffic of people coming in and out of both hotels, I was happy to be here. Rooms are small but clean and I liked that since we got there early our rooms were ready. Wi-fi is free in the lobby area and breakfast was very good. We were not traveling with our kids this time so my most important consideration was to be in the center of town and we were. We ate dinner once at their restaurant and the food is simple, excellent and reasonable. While we appreciated being accommodated early (check-in), on the day of checkout, somebody kept knocking on our door even before we had breakfast. Our bus was not leaving until late. We were not planning to overstay our welcome but it would have been nice to get our things together after eating breakfast and not to be disturbed so we ended up putting the "Don't Disturb" sign until we were ready to leave. Other than that, everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: wowfactor
Reviews.Content: The good points: - the rooms are very clean, comfortable and well appointed. Loved the mirrors with sights of Berlin - the hotel was quiet with little noise - the breakfast was good. Lots of choice and fresh - easy trip on the bus from the airport, although the hotel's not easy to find once you get off The not so good: - the service isn't great. The woman on reception couldn't find my booking and was none too bothered about it either - the strange man who came into my room at 8 am in the morning. No knocking, no "housekeeping", just saw me and went out again. And that's giving hiim the benefit of the doubt that he was hotel staff. I would have given this hotel a higher rating for comfort etc, but as a single woman traveller the security and service would mean I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself was good but the gym and wifi was poor.”
Reviews.Author: AjmalSultany
Reviews.Content: Nice place in a good location. I was on a business trip so I base my experience on two factors: the quality of wifi and gym. As for the gym, I feel that they have made it only to tick a box. There was only 5 machines in a very small room. As for the wifi, you have to pay in your room or use for free only in the lobby area. And even then, it would log you out every 15 minutes so it becomes a little frustrating to log on again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: Gravitania
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business. Very slow check in and out with two very moody reception clerks. Not good if you need to catch a train. The rooms are on the small side, but comfortable and quiet,despite the busy street it is located on. You have to pay to get wifi through a complicated T-mobile system. The train station Alexanderplatz is within 10 mins. walk. Plenty of shops and restaurants in the area, which was just on the former border of East Berlin. If the price is under 80, it is ok, if not, you can get better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great location for Metro but not for Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Peter_MacPherson
Reviews.Content: In a great location for exploring Berlin. However, the nightlife around Alexanderplatz is poor at best, and don’t try and find a good restaurant around Alexanderplatz there’s not! The room was quite small and pleasant and the bathroom was stunning. Positives: Nice rooms and lovely breakfast – good choice of food Negatives: No Tea / Coffee making facilities, no mini-bar, no fridge, room service drinks menu was limited, they would not serve a simple gin and tonic to the room. The Bar was advertised in the brochure to open at 16.30 but did not open until 18.00 (the bar should be open all day!)Pillows weren’t that great. Location great for metro but not for night-time entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, close to Prenzlauer Berg (which is nice)”
Reviews.Author: Elizzze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five nights during christmas time and we had a good time over there. The rooms were a bit small, but clean which I found the most important. The location is really great and we loved exploring Prenzlauer Berg. Close to the hotel are a lot of nice restaurants, just 5-15 minutes walk away. The staff was friendly although they didn't speak English very well. One of the guys at the reception did speak English very well and he recommended us a few VERY nice restaurants near the hotel. The breakfast was good, a lot of fresh fruit and vegetables.

Reviews.Title: “good berlin business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogontour
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to be almost new. It deserves it's 4 stars. Nice staff who are very helpful, good clean rooms in a modern 'standard' hotel design. Our only complaint is that in our room on the top floor facing rear, we had awful cellphone reception on all networks. Front facing is better I am told. Spa looks good but we didn't have time to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay.”
Reviews.Author: ReaperX
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is good, near to restaurants and shopping malls. Nothing to shout about the rooms, small, good designs and pretty well maintained. Breakfast was okay, with a variety of pastries and sausages. Staffs were quite friendly. Good 3 nights stay over here.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experiences”
Reviews.Author: Touristlove
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't welcome us as the service is poor and rude.On the first day of breakfast, the staffs on tudi I'd very good and friendly to kids but unfortunately the following days were not. The staff are very very rude and did not respect us ( Asian )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to visit Berlin or business”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: Mu stay was from 01/11/2012 tot 01/14/2012 - Top price/quality, Nice rooms, not to big and no bath,...But very clean en amazing quit, There is a nice sauna, no swimmingpool, WIFI in the lobby works fine, in the rooms is extra charge,.. Breakfast very good Location very good, near by busses, train en metro and TV tower,.. I will recommanded to others

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Janet O
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the main turistic sites and close to subway. Very comfortable and clever design. This is a new hotel. It have amazing breakfast and price is good. I like it and i will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rob_M_UK
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable, quiet and tastefully decorated, everything appeared to be new and was very clean. The staff were friendly. There is a small gym area on the 8th floor but it only has 4 pieces of equipment. Free wi-fi was advertised when I made my booking but was not available in the room, I had to pay 35 Euro for 30 days access on the T-mobile hotspot.

Reviews.Title: “clean , friendly, nice location, but”
Reviews.Author: bibi-ikke
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for our first city trip to Berlin. Choose this hotel because of the location,, because it is recently renovated and the okay prices. When we arrived early on a friday morning we were helped friendly by the staff and it was no issue to get our keys already at 12. Great. The parking lot is very convenient and we did not book it in advance. No problem getting in and leaving the car there. Actually Ramada and H2O hotel (which is ramadas neighbour) share the same parking lot. I had phoned the hotel before to ask if they provide the berlin welcome card and they told me their concierge could. If you are interested in this "welcome card" you can obtain it as of 3pm as that is the time the concierge arrives at the hotel. The rooms were tidy, clean, not big but comfortable enough. The floorheating in the bathroom is a plus. The heating/cooling system in the rooms though did not work or we could not figure out how to have them set appropriate to our wishes. We noticed that our mobiles had no reception at all in the room but they worked fine as soon as we got out into the hall. There is a free bottle of water in each room. A small safe is available as well but no minibar. The mattresses we found too hard to sleep on. Checking out went smoothly and again friendly staff. A safety remark: The elevator - key system which allows you to get to the upper floors only when in possession of a validated key left us with a pleasant feeling. From the parking lot you can only get to the reception floor if you do not have a roomkey and that adds to safety a lot.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Ideal location so close to Alexanderplatz. Great transport links to whole city. Lots happening in the locality, shopping, restaurants, bars, etc. Large train station close by with easy access to all areas. Staff were very helpful and multi-lingual. Room cleaned to an excellent standard every day with attention to small details.The breakfast included in our stay was good value for money and a wide choice of food. The reception staff were all helpful with any questions. There is no free wifi for guests! For this price there should definitely be.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazzamataz
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel. comfortable rooms - good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous”
Reviews.Author: Sandra777_11
Reviews.Content: HI,we were very impressed with the quality of the rooms and bathrooms, but also woudl have liked a kettle The hotel was let down by staff who are not trained, and not enough room in the public areas, and restaurant. The restaurant manager was incompetent, and rude. We were visiting the spa and were told as we left we could not use the lift, but they did not know where the stairs were, consequently we ended up in another hotel stair well, with no means of gaining entry back in to the hotel. We had to wait until another guest came to let us in the lift (our card would not work) we then had to leave the hotel with only a robe on and walk along the pavement to our hotel The reception desk laughed at us. This was a terrifying experience

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable festive stay”
Reviews.Author: whu81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada for 3 nights at the start of December for our first visit to Berlin. The location is really good. 5 mins walk from Alexanderplatz and the trains, 10 from the tv tower and 30 from the Brandenburg which is a really nice stroll. Also in the last few weeks a unique Munich style beer hall with great food and music has opened up just down the road which is great fun for a nightcap or 3. And for those who might worry about the sound dont, there's 2 more hotels between the ramada and it. Inside you can tell its new, very clean and comfortable. Rooms and bathrooms nicely decored, but we were disappointed that the double is basically two twins stuck together with separate duvets. Also there were no coffee/tea making facilities which when you have spent the day out and about would have been welcome so pack a travel kettle! Also when we booked it it was advertised as free wifi in the rooms yet as mentioned elsewhere this isn't now the case. They hotel have also taken account of Xmas with a very festive looking reception and free treats on offer on the front desk which is a nice touch. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend in berlin”
Reviews.Author: simplesNorthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Hotel at the end of October 2011. We would recommend the hotel one hundred per cent. The room was on the top floor and we had quite a walk as our room which was at the end of the corridor. The breakfast choice was huge; no one could go hungry or struggle to find something to their liking. We found the staff really lovely and very helpful. The hotel hired bicycles which we took advantage of and toured Berlin on bike..a brilliant and safe (lots of bicycle lanes) way to see the sights. The location is brilliant as the train station (three euros from the airport) is within easy walking distance (minutes) and the trams and buses are on the doorstep. We walked to bradenburg gate on the first day, it was a lovley walk. Autumn is a lovley time to visit this city. Alexanderplatz was wonderful, with shops and places to eat and drink. We felt very safe there and enjoyed many a late drink. My only concern would be the new pub/restaurant which was being built next to the hotel might prove to be a little noisey when completed....although it did look quite nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: stubbsy83
Reviews.Content: I was staying here as part of a tour group, so we didn't spend much time in the hotel really, as we were out all day. The rooms were very clean, the staff were always helpful and courteous, although the shower wasn't working on arrivel in the room... It was, however, fixed the day I reported the problem. Breakfast at the hotel was great, quite a wide selection of options. Probably a bit out of my bidget if I were to come to Berlin again, but fantastic location for getting to the rest of the city (there is an underground station in Alexanderplatz which is barely 5 mins away, and an overground station next to Alexanderplatz).

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Thong_Joy
Reviews.Content: Ramada Hotel Berlin - Alexanderplatz is centrally located with modern facilities and clean. Room size is bigger than usual for european hotels. Bathrooms and rooms looks new & clean. I was told that the hotel is about 2 years old. Complimentary water bottles are provided everyday. Bed is firm and comfortable; only whinge I would make is that pillows are too soft, it doesn't provide neck support at all. So get ready for a sore neck the next day! Bathrooms have heated floors which is excellent in cold weather! If you're late getting out of room ie. 9-9.30am -> housekeepers have a tendency to knock, annoucing their arrival and barge in without consent. This happened to us twice! In terms of locality it is centrally located with bus & tram nearby; also the Alexanderplatz underground & train stations are a 5 minutes walk away. You can get a day group (3 - 5 people) ticket for 15.50Euros for all day travel (all modes of transport). Also Alexanderplatz markets & retail shops are in the same locality as the underground. There are some good restaurants nearby - diagonally opposite the hotel we got good german fare ie. pork knuckles and saurkraut. If you're not up to paying 15Euros for breakfast at the hotel, goto the hotel next door and pay 8Euros for a buffet breakfast. Closeby too is a reasonably good spanish (Las Olas Spanish restaurant) which offers good atmosphere and tapas & italian restaurant. German service can be un-friendly but if the food is good.. The telecom tower is also nearby (10 mins walk away). However on level 38 of Park Inn hotel - you can also get a great view of Berlin city, paying half the price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “If you care for first impressions... Ramada Alexanderplatz is a slap on your face”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaPinto
Reviews.Content: So... here I am writing this review, not in my room as expected, but at the hotel lobby (wich is full of groups of tourists screaming off their lungs). When I made my reservation for Ramada I was very cautius to book a hotel with free wi-fi in the room. The whole stay was charged in advance and cancellation policy says that was not refundable. So, as I get to the hotel I was surprised to know that they have changed the policy of the wi-fi recently,providing free wi fi just at the common areas of the hotel. I asked to talk to the manager who was not able to give us anything in change, but one day only of breakfast. Later,as we are two people using the room, we asked to the front guy to give us another key and he said it was charged!!! 5 euros!!!! Another curious fact?? The concierge doesn't speak english!! How great is that?? A little tip about the location - it is really a central area,butif you can afford to stay at historical Mitte, do it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, incredibly clean!”
Reviews.Author: Charlmark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - just few minutes from subway - 5 short stops from Checkpoint Charlie! Hotel is incredibly clean and very fresh. Beds are really comfy. Room I stayed in was small but used space really well. Plenty of room for storage.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern hotel with good location, not particularly good value”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and paid about $280 per night including breakfast and free wi-fi. Overall, I would say that the hotel was a nice place to stay in the terrific transit hub of Alexanderplatz, and, being brand new, was very clean and modern, but not a particularly good value. It was odd in a hotel of this caliber that there was no refrigerator in the room, otherwise the room would have been perfect (small, but this is Berlin). The bathroom was well-lit with a walk-in shower. Breakfast had a fairly good variety, but the breakfast room seemed too busy and crowded all the time and the service staff was not very efficient (and did not speak good English). There were no eggs cooked to order, only powdered scrambled eggs. Overall, I think this hotel could put more effort into the total customer experience, but it's not bad for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep, slow staff”
Reviews.Author: Hoff-dk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to Alexanderplatz which is a great location for discovering Berlin. The rooms are quite small but the sleep and breakfast is perfect and you're close to plenty of sights, restaurants and bars. Breakfast is great (15 EUR) but wifi is not free. The staff at the reception seemed quite slow and they weren't aware that the hotel was paid up front.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: 19Caesar80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Alexanderplatz, merely a 5 min walk. So, the location is perfect. The hotel is nicely decorated like mainstream business hotels of this age: modern, simplistic and luxurious. Having only had breakfast, i cannot comment on the quality of the hotel's dinner. Breakfast is very good though. There are a lot of options and all are well prepared and tasty. Options in coffee are limited, although I did not specifically ask for more exotic coffee. Perhaps this is possible when asked. The only downside to this hotel is the size of the rooms. To my experience most 4* hotels in the business/conference class (in various cities/countries) offer slightly larger rooms, and these are often cheaper as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new hotel at good spot”
Reviews.Author: Skip75
Reviews.Content: Good and brand new hotel. Rooms are nice and clean, but not very spacious: not enough space to put and unpack your suitcase and only one chair to sit on. And no fridge, not even a small one. Quiet rooms: no sound from other guests and good double glazing. But as we did not get the airco working, we slept with open windows, and than it's noisy because of a lot of road works being done in the neighborhood at this moment. Very good shower! Staff very helpful, and rooms being cleaned perfectly every day. Good location, also when you don't want to do all the touristic activities and sightseeing: it's just in the middle of East and West Berlin, so you can choose to go West to Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Musea etc and be a tourist. Or else just cross the street and walk into East's Penzlauer Berg to sit on one of the many terraces and have a drink, diner, lunch or brunch, and shop in all the nice design and vintage shops. Club Week-end is also around the corner. We did not use breakfast in hotel, as in Penzlauer Berg around the corner there are lots of cheap(er) breakfast places to find. NOTE: bed sheets are anti-allergic, which is good, but pillows and duvets are filled with down/feather instead of synthetic filling, so for some people that might be not anti-allergic at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, well finished hotel”
Reviews.Author: justsimplyme
Reviews.Content: The concierge were well informed, helpful and could speak good English. Not too far from Alexandraplatz, albeit not as close as some hotels but not far enough to cause a problem. The room was very well maintained, as one would expect considering how modern and new the hotel is. Upon entering you are greeted with a fresh bottle of mineral water and your name appearing on the TV screen - a nice touch. The bed was fantastic and offered a great night sleep. The omission of a mini-bar was unfortunate as was the layout of the mirrors in the room as it was not possible to stand in front of the full length mirrors due to obstacles. However, this latter gripe may be limited to the design of our room specifically and may not be a reflection of all of the rooms in the hotel. The electronic user-controlled blinds were great at blocking out a good deal of sunlight. TV channels were good albeit fairly basic offering the usual CNN, BBC News etc. An excellent feature of the room is the sound loop between the TV in the bedroom and the bathroom which allows for listening to music whilst showering / shaving. The bathroom itself was very good. The shower was hot and powerful with plenty of room within the unit itself. There was also a heated floor with thermostat which could reach very warm temperatures. Unfortunately there was no heated towel rail. Perhaps the most off-putting thing about the bathroom was the door itself. There was only one door to the bathroom and toilet which was on a hinge that could either create an open plan bathroom and toilet area or a partition for a separate toilet area. This system didn't grant much privacy and the door was made out of frosted glass which, again, didn't grant much privacy. The towels were changed daily and the housekeeping service was generally very good, albeit quite hasty to gain access on the final day of our stay. The breakfast was very good with a diverse range of food on offer. Perhaps the staff could have done a slightly better job of cleaning down the tables faster and more thoroughly as, for example, the chair was slightly dirty when I came to sit down. Overall - excellent stay for a great price (obtained through a late deal via lastminute.com). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “VERY RESONABLY PRICED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DublinCarolk
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, very good value, perfect for sight seeing in east Berlin, close to all attractions. There is still some building work in the local area but nothing to complain about. The breakfast is excellant. Close to Alexanderplatz S Bahn station

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Hotel Berlin-Alexanderplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Karl-Liebknecht-Strasse 32, 10178 Berlin, Germany
